definition: lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: But even that makes insecure Pakistanis jumpy.
sentences.chinese: 但是即使那样也使感觉不安全的巴基斯坦人心惊肉跳。

sentences.english: The old lady knew that something was going to happen, and she was very jumpy .
sentences.chinese: 这老太太知道要出事了，于是吓得心惊肉跳。

sentences.english: She was jumpy during her job interview because she was so nervous.
sentences.chinese: 她在应征面谈的时候心惊肉跳，因为她太紧张了。

sentences.english: The hooting of an owl broke the silence now and again, giving Linda the creeps.
sentences.chinese: 猫头鹰的叫声不时打破寂静，使琳达心惊肉跳。

sentences.english: Even later, the clock in the parlour chimes twelve heartbeats.
sentences.chinese: 再后来，客厅的钟心惊肉跳地敲打了十二下。

sentences.english: I get the willies just standing here.
sentences.chinese: 光站在这里我就心惊肉跳的了。

sentences.english: The dark, dank cave gave me the willies.
sentences.chinese: 这阴暗潮湿的山洞使我感到心惊肉跳。

sentences.english: The murder scene in the film horrified me .
sentences.chinese: 电影中的暗杀场面使我心惊肉跳。

sentences.english: A New Thinking of War and Peace;
sentences.chinese: 想到未来的核子战争，人人心惊肉跳。

sentences.english: His heart quaked with panic at the news.
sentences.chinese: 这个消息令他心惊肉跳。

sentences.english: A person walking on it dare not look sideways, and a gust of wind would make him tremble with fear.
sentences.chinese: 人走在上面不敢斜视，山风袭来，更让人心惊肉跳。

sentences.english: You keep looking at the clock and are alarmed at time passing.
sentences.chinese: 你不停地看表心惊肉跳的看每一秒过去。

definition: lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
to tremble with fear (idiom)/scared witless
panic-stricken
to have one's hair stand on end (idiom)/to feel one's blood run cold
fearful/apprehensive
staggering/shocking/frightened
to fear/to be terrified
to feel terrified/to grow apprehensive
shiver all over though not cold/tremble with fear/shudder
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
frightened/terrified
variant of 發怵|发怵[fa1 chu4]
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to quake in fear
dumbstruck (idiom); stupefied/stunned
